website_summaries.verdict: Reasonable price point for chia seeds that work well for all types of recipes.
pros: These seeds have a neutral taste that enhances the food you mix them into
Delivers extra fiber and protein you want in recipes
Ships in a jar instead of a plastic bag, making it easier to access the seeds
cons: Some quality control issues reported with plant matter mixed in with the seeds

customer_reviews.title: Bugs in the container!
customer_reviews.text: Just opened this container and put the scooper in to use in a drink and bugs started crawling up the measuring spoon! How do I return this! Do not buy!
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Liveoak

customer_reviews.title: Small moving things appeared inside
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thing 3-4 months ago, always kept cap closed in dark place. Today i saw very small creatures moving inside. I can send the product to seller if they want to analyze.
customer_reviews.author: Saner K.

customer_reviews.title: So much dirt
customer_reviews.text: Has too much dirt in it. I like to put chia seeds in my drinking water but I kept getting dirt along with the seeds. I’ve never had this problem with other brands.
customer_reviews.author: J. Swift

customer_reviews.title: Seeds mixed with twigs:(
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed, maybe it’s only on the batch that I bought but it is full of little twigs that are very hard... impossible to eat without sorting my seeds first. Won’t buy again.
customer_reviews.author: W. D

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t recommend it to my enemies.
customer_reviews.text: Beware the quality. Loads of sand rocks or dried seeds are amongst it. The overall quality is very poor. Ended up feeding the wild birds with it.
customer_reviews.author: A. A.

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Not good quality product, had rodents dropping. Don't buy this.
customer_reviews.author: DeadHead

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy unless you want bugs
customer_reviews.text: The other reviews are right. I was looking to restock on chia seeds since i've been buying this brand for a while but when I read the reviews there were complaints of bugs. This morning when I was making my smoothie I took a closer look and sure enough there were little tiny bugs crawling all over the seeds. Whoever is in charge of quality control should be fired.
customer_reviews.author: Juan Novoa

customer_reviews.title: Pantry moth's net inside
customer_reviews.text: Bought this with pantry moth. It got something that looked like spider net inside of it. 5 stars for Amazon for making things right, 1 star for the product.
customer_reviews.author: Kmark

customer_reviews.title: Tiny seeds with others dirt stuffs mixed. Should pay ...
customer_reviews.text: Tiny seeds with others dirt stuffs mixed. Should pay a little more money to get quality rather than this cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Toni L.

customer_reviews.title: It’s static, not bugs. There are little sticks though.
customer_reviews.text: For the people who saw the one star reviews, there were no bugs in my container. There is however a good amount of static from the plastic, which makes the small seeds jump around alarmingly and also makes them appear to stick to the sides of the container as if there were cobwebs inside. I will say that there are a few small sticks no more than 1 cm long and about the thickness of a human hair. But seriously... we’re eating seeds and complaining about sticks? For this price, you all will survive.
customer_reviews.author: Hicks403

customer_reviews.title: Great flavor and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I have seen some reviewers that said that they got a container that had "bugs" inside. What I found was the plastic container had a static build-up and caused some of the seeds to adhere intermittently to the sides and it looked like they were moving. they were just seeds and no bugs. The container I got was fresh and tasty and I will buy another of this brand when I run out.
customer_reviews.author: snarfzilla

customer_reviews.title: It's Static not bugs!
customer_reviews.text: I was reading these reviews after I purchased the product because I thought it was a great value, then I saw a ton of reviews saying there were bugs in the chia seeds. So as soon as I received mine i was quick to inspect them. Looks like the static in the can makes some seeds move and look as though they are tiny insects, some times you need to read more reviews and see for yourself! I absolutely love these and have already used them quite a bit! I will definitely repurchase! and you cant beat the value!!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Seem Good to Me
customer_reviews.text: I’ve said this before about other products; I do not know the difference between good and bad chia seeds. What I do know is that these were rated highly here on Amazon, the price was good, and they taste fine in my oatmeal and protein smoothies. If you are looking for chia seeds, give these a try. If you actually know the difference between good and bad chia seeds, please come back here and tell me. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Gave me stomach cramps
customer_reviews.text: Don’t know what it is about these specific chia seeds but they gave me killer stomach cramps. I didn’t suspect them at first since i’ve always drank water with chia seeds in it on a daily basis. Took some trial and error but eventually pinned it down to these guys.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Raul Roca-Leon

customer_reviews.title: BUGS IN THE CONTAINER!! do not buy
customer_reviews.text: i’ve never been so disgusted. i’ve had these product for maybe two months now and i haven’t gotten around to using them yet. last night i decided to make a smoothie and thought it’d be a good idea to throw in some chia seeds. there was tiny bugs crawling in between seeds even on the scooper that comes with the container. this is unbelievably disgusting!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bugs!
customer_reviews.text: Bugs! I couldn't believe it when I opened it fresh yesterday, there were tiny bugs inside!
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: This is what I get for trying to be healthy
customer_reviews.text: Lord I read the reviews about people finding little live things inside the product but I figured the issue was corrected. NOPE. I first noticed a small piece of plastic then quickly saw little jumping things moving around.
customer_reviews.author: Cam Guerrero

customer_reviews.title: Tablespoon Included!
customer_reviews.text: These are incredibly perfect Chia seeds! I only recommend soaking them overnight and pulverizing them by blender in a smoothie otherwise seeds become stuck in the body and they are not absorbed as everyone believes. The best part is not only are they high quality but they come with a plastic tablespoon inside! For me this is fantastic because I'm always scrambling for a tablespoon to measure this or that in the kitchen. I don't think I could have enough tablespoons. I love that every evening there's a little scoop inside so I'm able to measure my chia seeds to soak overnight for my morning smoothie.
customer_reviews.author: Raynebow Ocean

customer_reviews.title: Mixed with black pebbles, wouldn't buy again
customer_reviews.text: The chia seeds are good but there are little black pebbles mixed in with them. When you add water, they are very obvious because they don't swell like the chia.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Became Bird or Wild Animal Food
customer_reviews.text: When I ordered the BetterBody Foods Organic Chia Seeds with Omega-3, Non-GMO, I did not expect to see a list of the third world countries it might have come from. So, then I read the reviews, some good ones, some bad ones. When I read that some people stated they had found sand, twigs, and rodent droppings in their chia seeds, I opted not to use it for human consumption. We threw it in an open field, for wildlife to possibly consume. The next time I buy Chia Seeds, I want to know where the product originated and hear more good reviews.
customer_reviews.author: L H Warrick

customer_reviews.title: The measuring spoon is a clever and useful touch.
customer_reviews.text: These are the best tasting chia seeds that I have found. They are also the cheapest. I mix 1 or 2 tsp. of chia with 6 oz. of yogurt, 1/3 cup of milk, and 1/4 cup of oatmeal and refrigerate them overnight. I breakfast on a flavorful and healthful pudding. I do wish the spoon that comes with it was long enough to reach the bottom of the jar.
customer_reviews.author: P. Mau

customer_reviews.title: No more joint pain
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why people wrote they have seen bugs in it. This is my 4th purchase of this brand. IF YOU HAVE JOINT PAIN USE THIS DAILY, my elbows and knees were so bad I'd cry. Since using this daily I haven't had pain. I stopped using it for a few weeks after running out and it started to return. You don't need pharmaceuticals you need nature to cure yourself. The only downfall with chia is constipation. I already have issues this doesn't help! I use it by mixing a small amount of pancake mix, quick oats, chia, flax powder and make healthy pancakes. I eat them buttered no syrup. The flax powder makes them fluffy plus helps constipation.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Contains Bugs
customer_reviews.text: I would give this zero stars if I could. I bought this for my daughter two or three months ago, and she added the seeds to oatmeal and smoothies. We kept it sealed in a cabinet when not in use, since according to the instructions it didn't need to be refrigerated. Last week she noticed tiny black bugs crawling inside the container.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for weight losw
customer_reviews.text: Trying to lose weight? Chia seeds are your friend. I have recently lost a lot of weight and I credit chia seeds for part of it. I mix plain or vanilla Greek yogurt with 1T chia seeds and 1/2 cup frozen blueberries each morning and let it sit. As the blueberries defrost, the chia seeds absorb the water. I eat it at noon and the chia seeds are about double the size. The yogurt is thick. It’s very, very filling. You can also mix it up and let the magic happen overnight. It also works with oatmeal to thicken it and keep you full.
customer_reviews.author: what.it.is

customer_reviews.title: Great Great Great...
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several brands and really really like this one. I put chia seeds in my yogurt bowl that I make the day/evening before (along with raw oatmeal, cinnamon, and wild frozen blueberries). Just saw on Consumer Lab reports that they reviewed many CHIA SEED brands, and this brand is #1 - the best of all tested. Some of the other brands actually have LEAD in them. BETTERBODY FOODS Chia seeds are CLEAN!! Wow, I sure picked a great one!
customer_reviews.author: M Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: its mixed with something!
customer_reviews.text: not sure why it is mixed with dirt/sand but I was chuing on it every time I used chia seeds! don't go with this cheap price!!!
customer_reviews.author: Arina

customer_reviews.title: Sprinkle on everything
customer_reviews.text: I sprinkle these on everything I eat so that I get enough to make a difference. Little extras like these seeds allow me to stop buying additional supplements. Food as medicine. I keep mine in the refrigerator because I’ve read some reviews where some contained bugs. Now I will always worry. If you mash up strawberries (or any fruit) add these seeds and a little water, let it soak in the frig overnight and you have jelly so healthy that even diabetics can enjoy it.
customer_reviews.author: NauticalDiva

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value for your money!
customer_reviews.text: I like my chia seeds on anything — oatmeal, toasts, I make home made strawberry jam with agave and chia seeds (take a pound of strawberries, warm them up on a low heat with 3 tbsp agave or honey; when it softens enough mash it with a potato masher and add 2 tbsp chia seeds, constantly stirring warm of up for 7-10 minutes — enjoy your fresh sugar free jam!) Not only that chia seeds are perfect antioxidants but also it provides a great nutritional value! I like to add it into oatmeal as well. Delicious! Packaging was great too, will be ordering more after my jar is done:)
customer_reviews.author: Arielajv

customer_reviews.title: FULL OF TWIGS AND FOREIGN MATTER
customer_reviews.text: This is full of twigs. Gross. Glad I read the reviews or I wouldn’t have noticed them stuck all over the sides of the plastic until I already ate some. Also, I am NOT just saying this because I’m a competitor!!! I am a very disappointed cheapskate REAL customer who should’ve known this price was too good to be true. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Aggy Beekay

customer_reviews.title: the right amount and I like the jar
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my staples. I buy several at a time. I buy this brand because it is organic, the right amount and I like the jar. I prefer the container to any other chia seed product I've tried because the seeds don't stick to the sides like in a plastic bag. And the size of the jar is just right for giving me enough and fitting in with a bunch of mason jars filled with other items. The seeds themselves are great - I've been including 2 heaping tbsps of chia seeds in my breakfast smoothie for several years now and I find it gives me energy and makes me feel good.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Castellino

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I LOL’d pretty hard when I saw people posting pictures of simple static electricity, claiming it was bugs 😂 WOW. But these are great quality, work amazing for my chia pudding, and are a phenomenal price compared to buying Great Value brand at Walmart.
customer_reviews.author: AJD

customer_reviews.title: Tiny black bugs in it.  Threw it away.  Don’t buy this product.
customer_reviews.text: Tiny black bugs in it, same as another person who reviewed it in past, was hoping it was just their batch but nope.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonlover2k

customer_reviews.title: Bugs!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a few months ago - and stored as per manufacturers instructions - Just noticed hundreds of tiny BUGS in the jar - it was never left open and no moisture was introduced - unless the manufacturer clarifies, do not recommend this and will not buy again!
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: I love Chia seeds and BetterBody Foods Organic Chia Seeds are ...
customer_reviews.text: I love Chia seeds and BetterBody Foods Organic Chia Seeds are on my repeat buy list. They are fresh and have a slightly nutty flavor. I do soak a serving in water first and then add to yogurt or smoothies. They provide the most health benefit when soaking first.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Tasty, fresh, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Chia seeds themselves have many uses in our foods. You can stir them up in a liquid, let them expand, and then drink that, or sprinkle on a salad or yogurt, or whatever. They release a natural gelatin when wet, which is helpful, and their husks are essentially bulk fiber. This jar holds enough for a year, probably, unless you're just using them everywhere. A spoonful or so a day works for me. They're very tasty in the sense that they are pleasant and crunchy at first, and then they soften into little "nibbles." The packaging is easy to open and use, with a wide top so you can get a good spoonful. 100% satisfied with this.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Matlock

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: I read some negative reviews about bugs and mold in the container. I've been inspecting mine and maybe because I've been careful not to allow moisture in, I don't know, but my batch looks clean. I was buying the store no-name brand of chia seed for the same price but half the size and price, and there is a difference. The store brand, the chia seed, although soaked, sunk to the bottom. This chia seed soaked, rises to the top. I don't know the change nutritionally, but this is a good sign.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Vuong

customer_reviews.title: Convenient way to order chia
customer_reviews.text: I have oatmeal for breakfast every day, and these are one of the three things I sprinkle on it. According to the Internets: "Chia seeds are a good source of omega-3 fatty acids, fiber, antioxidants, iron, and calcium. A 28-gram, or 1-ounce, serving of chia seeds also contains 5.6 grams of protein." I order it on Amazon for the convenience. I used to buy it from the bulk bins, but this is less work, and it's easier to keep it fresh due to the durable container it comes in. I'll keep buying it, unless I see a rival offer it for less.
customer_reviews.author: GTS

customer_reviews.title: I Love This Brand
customer_reviews.text: I love this brand! Fresh, inexpensive, tasty, and in a serviceable container instead of a resealable bag that will never, ever, reseal. Not even NASA engineers can reseal any of these resealable bags! So, this nice container makes me happy. And? The scoop that's inside? Oh, it is perfect for these seeds. A regular tablespoon is no bueno. You will have these little @$%%#'s everywhere. I use these in yogurt and oatmeal. They add protein, fiber, and great, crunchy texture. I even add them to cereal! Buy these Chia seeds. Love them. Love the container. Love the scoop (really, you have no idea). Cheers! AW
customer_reviews.author: AW

customer_reviews.title: LOVE!
customer_reviews.text: My first time trying Chia seeds. I put them in my bottled water, let them swell, and drink them down!! They don't have a taste but feel funny when I drink them, but it doesn't bother me. Provides a full feeling when I need some food on the go. Usually chugging them when I'm running late to work. Great buy!!! I will be purchasing more.
customer_reviews.author: CoCo

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Fresh and I love the easy pour and easy scoop packaging. Good price for organic chia seeds too. I put two tablespoons in my oatmeal with a tablespoon of cacao or cocoa powder and it’s delicious. I also use this to make chia seed ham that’s the greatest stuff ever on pancakes: 1 cup frozen fruit (blueberries, raspberries, strawberries, etc), 2 TB orange juice, and 2 TB chia seeds. Mom need to heat it. Just put it in a container and the liquid from the defrosted fruit interacts with the chia seeds which makes a delicious vegan fruit gel. Good way to get those good healthy omega 3 fats!
customer_reviews.author: Mic Mac

customer_reviews.title: Highest quality at a most reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered this product more than once and each time was very pleased with what I received. I use it not only as a health aid to add omega-3 and to keep my digestive system functioning as it should (the fiber is a real blessing) but also to help me cut sugar out of my diet (make chia seed pudding w/water, stevia and toggle between cinnamon or an unsweetened cocoa powder). This not only satisfies my craving for sweets but actually is a treat with real satiety and no rebound sugar effect. All positives for me. This is a product I will always have in my cupboard.
customer_reviews.author: StealthMode

customer_reviews.title: Good price on chia seeds.  Stop putting that stupid measuring spoon in it.
customer_reviews.text: I eat a lot of chia (one of these 2# containers lasts less than a month). It's our breakfast pretty much every day. The seeds seem fine and price is very good. I just wish they would stop putting that stupid little measuring spoon inside. I transfer mine to a jar anyway and the spoon just gets in the way when I am dumping it out. Even if you didn't own a tablespoon (Amazon does sell them), you would have to dig to the bottom of the jar of highly electrostatically charged seeds to find it before you could use it.
customer_reviews.author: M. L. Goodson

customer_reviews.title: Approve and Top Rated by Consumer Lab
customer_reviews.text: I chose this brand based on the indepent Consumer Lab testing of this product. Consumer Lab approved and considered it a Top Pick. If you aren't familia with Consumer Lab, check it out. Unless you subscribe to Consumer Lab (pay a fee), you can't access the extensive reports. However, it does still have a great deal of information available without a fee.
customer_reviews.author: M M.

customer_reviews.title: really fresh and clean.
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to buy this product because of some reviewers stating that they found wood sticks and some even bugs on the product, I thought about give it a chance because of the price, this product is the cheapest one you will find, and it is very well packaged, the seeds are clean, I couldn't find anything but seeds on the jar. very well recommended, as matter of fact, I am buying another one right now. by the way,to whom it may concern, seeds may come from, Argentina, Bolivia, Mexico, Nicaragua, Paraguay and or Peru.
customer_reviews.author: Patricio & Heidy

customer_reviews.title: Giant Jug of Seeds
customer_reviews.text: Despite having seen the size prior to ordering, I was still surprised by how much I got. There was a little denting on one corner of the container but both it and the lid were intact so no big deal. I even discovered an unexpected scoop buried in there when I got about halfway through the seeds. No complaints on the contents. Fresh seeds with a nice nutty flavor and good pop when you bite into them. I even tried sprouting a couple just to see if they were viable, and they germinated.
customer_reviews.author: dibbledaba

customer_reviews.title: Happy with product.
customer_reviews.text: Just received the seeds. After reading previous reviews, I poured about half the seeds into a bowl and checked very carefully for twigs and bugs and it was fine. Seems fresh and tasted the way Chia always has. I'm happy with this product and will buy again. That being said, I live along the gulf coast and just to be on the safe side, plan to keep the jar either refrigerated or frozen just in case there are bug eggs in it. (Some things are better not to know.)
customer_reviews.author: Cija in Texas

customer_reviews.title: Best price on the market. Very high quality chia!
customer_reviews.text: I love all of Chia health benefits. Pros: - Provides Omega 3 fatty acids. - It's a good source of protein. - Very high fiber food source. - High antioxidants. - Versatility. It can be added to almost anything. - Increases satiety. - This product size can last up to a year depending on use. I use it daily. - Each container has a measuring tablespoon size of one tablespoon. - Unbeatable price. Best price on the market. Cons: - It can cause constipation if you don't drink enough water.
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Great value, good quality
customer_reviews.text: Despite the large quantity, this big jar of chia seeds was actually cheaper than most of the smaller packages on Amazon. It includes a small scoop inside, and importantly, no dirt or debris that other brands sometimes have.
customer_reviews.author: Speedy

customer_reviews.title: Bugs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about 4 months ago, not a widely used product for me, but when I went to use it for the second time last night, I opened the container and some little moth looking insects flew out. I dumped out a part of the chia seeds in the trash and there was a good bit of web type things in the container. I wish I would have taken a picture to post but I was kind of grossed out when I found this. So much for my chia seed pudding!
customer_reviews.author: Kellie Rector

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product with a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I use chia seeds in smoothies and had been buying Bob's Red Mill in my grocery store. The cost and packaging of this product is far superior to the Bob's product. The box is pretty big and bulky and takes up a lot of space in the fridge, so I pour it into a wheat germ bottle that fits in my fridge. The remainder goes into the freezer, where it keeps fine. At six months under these conditions, freshness remains and my fridge has space for other smoothie ingredients.
customer_reviews.author: World Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: My friend got me hooked on chia seeds in my water. I was skeptical about it at first because they look like little tadpoles in water bottles BUT they are great! I only use them in my water to help me feel full because I have a snacking problem when I’m at work. I will not lie, the texture is odd and it’s not for everyone. To be honest I like it though. The longer you leave them in your water, the more they expand. A little goes a long way.
customer_reviews.author: Victoria

customer_reviews.title: Exactly What I Was Looking For
customer_reviews.text: I won't claim to be a Chia Seed expert. But these are exactly what I wanted. The container is sturdy. The product passes my quality inspection. It arrived well sealed and has stayed that way between uses in my pantry. The included scoop is handy and the keto chia puddings I make come out tasty. I'll definitely order again if I ever make it through this container. (It's huge!)
customer_reviews.author: Jen M

customer_reviews.title: Just Chia Seeds
customer_reviews.text: Bugs? No bugs. That's static making the seeds bounce around. Sand? No sand Stems/sticks/debris? Nope none of that either. I was hesitant to order this based on some of the bad reviews. I shouldn't have been. Looks to be a quality product. Made my overnight pudding with a quarter cup seeds and 1 cup vanilla milk. Tastes and looks just like the expensive organic seeds I got at the local store. Will buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Lea

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service.
customer_reviews.text: I wasnt too happy that the bag was torn up but i checked the seal and it was fine for the first one that I ordered. I requested another product because i saw what looked like to be in a shape of a worm but they didnt move and they were hard... Not for sure what they were. The second one to replace my first one looks great without the yellow looking odd items in the container. Again I dont know if they were dead bugs or dried plant matter? None the less I ended up satisfied with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: No Insects!
customer_reviews.text: I got this a couple of days ago and as a Biologist I was kind of dissapointed I did not find any bugs to identify. The seeds are just reacting to the static of the container. Either way I've been adding them to smoothies and drinks and I really love how palpable they are. They do get kind of slimy and adhere to the sides of containers easily when wet. Their faint flavor won't affect the taste of many dishes or drinks you add them to.
customer_reviews.author: Coenocytic

customer_reviews.title: Chia Pet
customer_reviews.text: My daughter fed these to our dog. She said she wanted a Chia Pet. Didn't work...thank goodness.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Morreale

customer_reviews.title: "NO!" bugs
customer_reviews.text: It is late June 2020. Got my bottle in March 2020. I live in a hot Arid climate. Nothing found walking, strolling, or moving among the chia seeds No rocks! No twigs. Just Chia. I like the small simple-crunch the seeds give to "mush" foods like oatmeal, grits, rice, beans and a lot more. They almost give these "mush" foods a somewhat tolerable texture. If I were to express a complaint, the handle on the included scoop could be sufficiently longer so it is useful and so it does not get lost at the bottom of the chia container where it becomes a chore to fish it to the surface so it can be used!
customer_reviews.author: ErSing

customer_reviews.title: 👍🏻Quantity and quality. Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: Let me tell ya, I love these little seeds in just about everything. Oatmeal, smoothies, chia pudding, energy and granola bars, etc. My kiddos like to help me grow them in little pots for our “shmoovies”. They come in a big container with a wide top so it’s super easy to get your hand in there with the scoop. It does come with a 1 tbs. scoop. We’ll be coming back for more. Great product for a good price. You will get your money’s worth. If you found this review helpful, please consider hitting the “helpful” button to let me know. Thanks and happy shopping!
customer_reviews.author: Miss. Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Product
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this product seems good. Fresh, clean (nothing but the seeds), NO BUGS! I put it on yogurt for breakfast. My research shows it is a super food - full of good health benefits. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: CrisM   (calif)

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous price
customer_reviews.text: I’m including a video of opening my product. (It’s under unboxing-won’t let me include it here) No bugs, some tiny twigs, BUT after further research I’ve found : it’s nearly impossible to avoid other organic material with seeds like these. Same with flaxseed. It is parts of the plants and such apparently. It won’t keep me from buying it. The price point is AMAZING. I challenge you to find this amount of chia seeds for less!
customer_reviews.author: C. Peters

customer_reviews.title: No Bugs in Mine!
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit alarmed by the mixed reviews, and carefully checked my package when it arrived. The package had an airtight seal, and although there was a bit of static electricity that caused some seeds to cling to the sides of the container, there were no bugs in sight. Whew! There were a few more brown, immature seeds in the mix than the previous bag I had from another brand, but for the price, I'll deal with it.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Exelent quality
customer_reviews.text: I read reviews from others and I was about to avoid buying this product. Finally I decided to try it out, and I don't have any regrets. The presentation and quality are exelent. I highly recommend it. Don't hesitate in buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Rosaura Dobles

customer_reviews.title: Please do not buy
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of the reviews and even tho I purchased this and was terrible, had weird things inside of the container, wasn't fresh , honestly was pretty bad. Good thing they gave me the money back without returning the product and I just put that on the trash !
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I’ve seen a lot of reviews about bugs and stems. Mine appear to be perfectly fine. (So far)
customer_reviews.author: Miller Girl

customer_reviews.title: Great source of fiber
customer_reviews.text: It's a amazing food that provides 37% fiber. Very easy to consume; it can be mixed to salad, or smoothies or whatever you like to. The seeds gets soften (jelly) easily in the presence of moisture so no issues to swallow. Will get another pack once it's done. Highly recommended if you feel like consuming fiber easy ways.
customer_reviews.author: Bibk R

customer_reviews.title: Pure chia seeds for a great price
customer_reviews.text: I read the other reviews about twigs and bugs so I was a little hesitant. I bought this anyway. Then I let it sit on my counter sealed for 2 weeks. Then I removed the seal and stirred it, recapped it, and waited 2 more weeks. No bugs. Also no twigs. I love chia seeds in my smoothies and this is an affordable way to get them.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Good Value!
customer_reviews.text: I found this to be the best value for Chia seed on Amazon and Ebay. I like the nutritional value of this seed and found it crucial to grind it finely and soak it in water or fruit juice before ingesting it. This rule holds true to most seeds and nuts in order to gain the most nutritional value.
customer_reviews.author: trigger

customer_reviews.title: only plant a fingernail  full of seeds per foot or two
customer_reviews.text: most people remember the chia pets most people don't know or realize that the chia plant is huge when allowed to flourish mine are four feet tall and not tended at all i just threw a cup full of seeds into garden not knowing myself about the growing rates at first it was carpet of greenery then became a forest for my chicks
customer_reviews.author: stoneboards

customer_reviews.title: I'm hooked on chia seeds
customer_reviews.text: A lot of value for your buck. I've had previous experience with bugs magically appearing in my chia seeds container, so I've been keeping this one in the fridge. There has been no problems so far. I have been taking this regularly and has noticed more of a regularity to my bowel movements. Making chia puddings is what I find as the easiest way to get my daily serving. Just be careful though that the seeds contain a lot of calories for their small size.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Smelled fermented...
customer_reviews.text: I've been ordering this brand for a while and have had no problems. My last order smelled funky - fermented and vinegary. I used the seeds for a while and never got sick, but finally decided they were just "not right". I chunked them and ordered a different brand. The only thing I can figure out is that they got warm and went bad. Yuck.
customer_reviews.author: Angela D

customer_reviews.title: Amazing deal!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this & the next day was reading some of the comments. The people were saying their containers has bugs inside. I kinda freaked out a little. Then the package arrived. To my delight there were no little buggies inside. High quality & fresh. No twigs/dirt. No bugs. Had to dig a little for the scoop but found it. Great value!
customer_reviews.author: John K

customer_reviews.title: Good!!!
customer_reviews.text: As others mentioned, packaging is not that great. My container has dents on the corners. Quality is great for the price paid. I liked the taste. Also, it is very clean and did not have any issues with any dirt, twigs or other material in the seeds. I would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Crazy Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Fresh product!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical about ordering this product due to some reviews saying they found bugs in it. Still gave it a try! I had no problems, and the product seems to be very fresh. Like others said, I think the static of some of the granules makes people think it might be a bug but if they look close enough they will see that’s just the granules. Great product!!
customer_reviews.author: daninha21

customer_reviews.title: DEAL OF THE CENTURY
customer_reviews.text: WOW, I’ve been buying this stuff for years in small bags, this brand is The deal if the century. I take 2TBS with water everyday as a natural clean out of your system...if you know what I mean! Its completely organic and does amazing stuff for your body., ancient secret of I believe the Amazon people.
customer_reviews.author: bootsie

customer_reviews.title: They give you a lot of seeds
customer_reviews.text: They give you lots of seed with plenty of time to finish it. Mine arrived with 3 years till expiration. They seeds takes around 30 mins of soaking to develop the jelly like shell. You will have to constantly stir while it’s soaking as the seeds tend to clump together if you don’t stir.
customer_reviews.author: Dalton

customer_reviews.title: Weight loss
customer_reviews.text: Great value!! Chia seeds WILL eat tummy fat !! I drink one water bottle with one scoop of seeds that have sat overnight in the fridge to swell them otherwise they can swell in your throat and choke you. It works give a month you’ll see the difference
customer_reviews.author: Keith&Kelly Richards

customer_reviews.title: Quality chia seeds, great value
customer_reviews.text: This jar will last you forever! I bought to put into my homemade overnight oatmeal which I eat each morning. The chia seeds are the perfect addition to my oatmeal. I've had the same jar for months and it's not even halfway gone. Definitely a good value. Will repurchase when I need to.
customer_reviews.author: Vada

customer_reviews.title: I use these every day.
customer_reviews.text: Can one overdose on chia? I keep 3 T in distilled in a mason jar refrigerated. This is dumped liberally into ever cup of tea, coffee or lemonade I consume. This should not, technically kill me. But fill my self with fiber and omega 3’s. I hope. I hope. And they’re fun. I like nibbling the tiny beads all throughout my beverage. I've used these seeds daily for months, with a short break, then bought this on Amazon. I've used for 2 months. This container lasts me 1 month-Happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonUser

customer_reviews.title: Great seeds
customer_reviews.text: First time trying chia seeds. These are great. Had no issues with them. Made a smoothie and added these to them. I did notice static in container caused the seeds to move around against container and made the seeds look like bugs inside. Don’t know, I didn’t have any issues with these. I would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: tz

customer_reviews.title: Positive affect on my Cholesterol
customer_reviews.text: Since starting to include Chia seeds in my diet my HDL cholesterol has increased to normal levels from being too low for as long as I can remember. My LDL cholesterol has remained at a normal level. Chia seeds are a great addition to my diet and are highly recommended. I only buy BetterBody Foods Organic Chia Seeds because they are organic, and they come in a handy container with a tablespoon scoop.
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: Very handy container
customer_reviews.text: The chia seeds are fresh and in a perfect container - can pour or scoop and also see what is inside. Good price for a basic item and handy to buy on Amazon because the stores might or might not have chia seeds in stock and I can't go from store to store hunting.
customer_reviews.author: PageTurner

customer_reviews.title: Delightful small crunch
customer_reviews.text: This giant container of Chia seeds arrived, just as ordered. I thought I would magically lose weight, it has yet to happen. I think I must be doing it wrong though. I have consistently added them to my ice cream and yet, no weight loss. 🤷‍♀️ I do think that they taste good, it’s like getting the seeds out of a strawberry and munching only on them, minus the strawberry. That pleases me.
customer_reviews.author: B.S.

customer_reviews.title: It's worth a shot! Will not be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I've previously purchased Chia seeds from other brands and there is no difference with this one. The taste and product is the same as other brands, but I like the fact that the packaging is BPA free! Keeps the product to eat more safe this way. Price is very competitive and I've purchased it 23 time as per this review.. Don't think twice and click the buy button!
customer_reviews.author: Aida

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Quality is on par with other chia seeds I buy, but the size and price are amazing! Will definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Super
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use, comes with a scoop. I have Oddle Noodle soup every morning, it is the best time for me to add about 1/4 scoop. You can not taste the chia. Can add it to anything you make. Glad I do not have to talk pills. The chia seed is so easy to use. It gives me protein and fiber.
customer_reviews.author: Buzz

customer_reviews.title: More Than Just a Pet
customer_reviews.text: I am gradually working my way from passionate carnivore to a more plant-based diet. One of the challenges is to find good sources of plant-based protein. My research led me to chia seeds as an excellent source of protein and fiber. I use a scoop of these in my morning shake that includes raw fruits and veggies, kefir, psyllium fiber,and ginger.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Good and cheap!
customer_reviews.text: I’m a college student therefore I am constantly looking for ways to be healthy while not spending too much money! I spent probably a good few hours looking at different online stores and researching on what is a descent price for chia seeds, and this was the product that I came to at the end. It’s cheap, good, and above all CHEAP! I never have time for breakfast so I have overnight oats prepared for 6 days of the week and 1TBSP of chia seeds is something I make sure is in it. This one container lasts me a little less than a semester but has saved me so much money for breakfast! Definitely recommend 👍🏼
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Z

customer_reviews.title: Good price and quality
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered this brand of chia seeds in the past and will continue to do so. I use them on my cold cereal like I would when I could eat sugar and they are good for you. My husband prepares many meals with this as part of the ingredients. The price is good and I like the container because it is rather large and you can grip the back side of it because it is tapered inward.
customer_reviews.author: SJones

customer_reviews.title: bugs!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what happened. I ordered 2 about a month ago. Ate thru the first jar no issues. Today my 2nd jar (factory sealed) had bugs inside of it. I ended up tossing it out.
customer_reviews.author: Sawedoffsob

customer_reviews.title: Great clean product. I recommend this product!
customer_reviews.text: Got my order and the first thing i did was pour it out into a huge baking pan to see if all the bad reviews had happened to me. There is not one piece of anything that wasn't a little chia seed. No bugs. Perfectly clean. So the problems they had with quality have been fixed. I would and have recommended this product to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I have been on a chia pudding kick lately, and realized this was a WAY better deal than even a Walmart store brand pouch. Tastes fine, storage is solid & stackable. The biggest downside for me is that the fully plastic tub, while possible to reuse for storage, is way too much packaging. This kind of plastic use is really unnecessary, and terrible for all involved. That will be a big consideration for me going forward. Product - great value and quality Packaging - wasteful and hard to justify
customer_reviews.author: LisaP

customer_reviews.title: No weevils on this Chia pet
customer_reviews.text: Great price for this amount of Chia seed. I also like the plastic cannisters which is so much better than the flimsy pouches that other manufactures use. I agree with other reviewers that the people saying that there are bugs in the package must be other suppliers trying to sabotage the review profile. If anything the plastic cannisters will keep out bugs such as weevils.
customer_reviews.author: Lochlan LongstriderTop Contributor: Drawing

customer_reviews.title: Good addition to any diet, both human and animal!
customer_reviews.text: I use these in many ways. In my salads and other dishes and I also sprinkle them over my cats' wet food. I keep them in the refrigerator. I think they are a good nutritional addition to any diet.
customer_reviews.author: Jo Holland

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value for a huge amount of great Chia Seeds!
customer_reviews.text: Great large container of Chia seeds that are very fresh and tasty. The price cannot be beat for the quantity. The easy screw on and off top lid makes me reassured that these will stay fresh for the year ahead - because that is about how long it may take me to get through these! I love using them for Chia pudding and they’re also great in smoothies for extra fiber and protein.
customer_reviews.author: amoc

customer_reviews.title: Great Value For Your Money!
customer_reviews.text: I use chia seeds on a daily basis in smoothies. This is the third brand I've tried because my grocery store stopped carrying and the other brand I purchased from Amazon wasn't large enough. While trying to restock myself on chia seeds I came across BetterBody, love the container first off (anyone who has tried to measure your almost empty bag knows what I mean) I also like that it has its own scoop, huge quantity for the price without sacrificing nutrition. Also no need to refrigeratorate!
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah

customer_reviews.title: Easy and Tasty Way to Get Superfoods
customer_reviews.text: I love the convenience of this jug of chia seeds, as it's easy to take out of the cabinet, scoop some out and ass them to my drink, yogurt, oatmeal etc. The taste is slightly nutty yet subtle, and they swell up perfectly in liquid to make a quick egg replacement or thich drink. I'll purchase these again.
customer_reviews.author: Amber A

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: I can say that im Skeptical at 1st to try this seed i thought im not gonna like it..it was recommended by a friend so i tried it.. the product came in and with a nice touch of free scooper and measuring number in it.. it taste fresh and i like to put it inside my water bottle.. you won’t taste no bitterness on the seeds.. i didnt expect that the tub is huge for a cheaper prize and it will gonna last me for months before im gonna purchase again.. thank you
customer_reviews.author: Whenny

customer_reviews.title: Love the container as well as those little seeds
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased Chia seeds in bag type packaging but the zip lock always seems to break so I was glad to find it in this handy little container. Chia seeds are funny little seeds you can add to all sorts of food and I love to make Chia pudding with it. Good deal
customer_reviews.author: S. Young

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the amount and quality of Chia you get
customer_reviews.text: I was so happy to find such a big package of chia. They arrived on time and in a perfect container so was able to just place it in the cabinet. The seeds are fresh and will purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Laticia G. Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Convenient nutritious: organic chia seeds- raw vegan
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Organic. Inexpensive. Convenient. Vegan. Omega 3. These can be mixed in with most foods. We love making Chia Pudding: just pour some in a bowl, pour organic soy milk over them, stir, add vanilla, and if you want some maple syrup or honey, stir again. Wait about 10 minutes and your pudding is ready. Also can be used as an egg substitute in baking.
customer_reviews.author: Freel

product_meta.title: BetterBody Foods Organic Chia Seeds with Omega-3, Non-GMO (2 Pound)
product_meta.description: Finding foods with lots of nutrients can be helpful for people who are trying to change their diet and live a better life. The word “chia” comes from the ancient Mayan word for strength. Why would the Mayans use such a powerful word for such a small seed? Well, chia seeds are loaded with nutrients such as fiber and omega-3 fatty acids. Our Organic Chia Seeds are nutrient powerhouses which is why they deserve to be associated with strength. They contain 37% of the daily recommended value of fiber to help the 97% of Americans who are fiber deficient. Because our chia seeds are flavor neutral flavorless, you can add them to just about anything to get a boost without changing the taste of your food. Just mix our chia seeds with your favorite breakfast shake, smoothie, bread batter, or other food that could use a little extra crunch that your family will love! Use them as a pre- or post-workout boost with protein powders that you are already using. You can also sprinkle the seeds as a topping on yogurt, salads, or cereal for a satisfying snack! Our Organic Chia Seeds also make a great egg replacement. Just mix 1 tbs. of chia seeds with 3 tbs. of water and let it sit for 5 minutes. Then use as an egg substitute in your favorite recipes. These Organic Chia Seeds are gluten-free, vegan, nut-free, raw, low-carb, non-GMO, and paleo-friendly, making them the perfect powerhouse for your pantry. BetterBody Foods is determined to bring you quality products that are better for your body but that don’t make you sacrifice the flavors that you enjoy. Find food that you’ll love to love with our 2 lbs. bulk container of Organic Chia Seeds!
feature_bullets: NUTRIENT POWER: This omega powerhouse is full of other useful nutrients that will help men and women live a better life. In every serving of our chia seeds, you’ll find many nutrients, including omega-3, and fiber, making it a great bonus to any protein shake or juice. Because it is flavor neutral, you can add it to drinks and shakes of all flavors without them clashing.

SIMPLY ORGANIC: Our Organic Chia Seeds are gluten-free, nut-free, low-carb, non-GMO, making them a great addition to your pantry, no matter your dietary restrictions. Whether you’re vegan, vegetarian, eating Keto or Paleo, or following another strict food regiment, you can easily incorporate this nutritious seed into your diet.

WITH OMEGA-3 & MORE: Chia seeds are loaded with 5350mg of omega-3, 10g of fiber, which is 7% of the DV recommended amount for fiber! In the ancient Mayan language, the word “chia” meant strength, so the name speaks for itself. Our Organic Chia Seeds can also be used as an egg replacement in any meal! Simply mix 1 tbs. of chia seeds with 3 tbs. of water and let sit for 5 minutes.

FLAVOR NEUTRAL FAVORITE: Chia seeds are a kitchen essential that many people don’t know about. You can add chia seeds to just about any food without having to worry about it upsetting the flavor of your dish. Because they are tasteless, you can use chia seeds to add texture to your food without drowning out the original flavor of your dish.

BLEND, BAKE, OR SHAKE: When it comes to the uses for our chia seeds, the possibilities are endless! Mix into baked goods like bread and muffins to add a little added crunch of protein and fiber. You can also sprinkle the seeds as a topping on some yogurt, pudding, salads, oatmeal, granola, or cereal for a satisfying snack!

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
